Package it.polimi.ingsw.client

Class ClientBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.ClientBoard
public class ClientBoard
extends java.lang.Object
Author:
Alice Piemonti This class is a simplified representation of the gameboard in model. It allows to have the status of the gameboard on client side.

  • Method Details

    • getGrid

      public Cell[][] getGrid()
      Returns:
      two-dimensional array which represents the status of the game board.

    • setWorkerNum

      public void setWorkerNum​(int row, int col, int num)
      the number of player's worker (1 or 2)
      Parameters:
      row - of the grid
      col - of the grid
      num - of the worker into player's array

    • getWorkerNum

      public int getWorkerNum​(int row, int col)
      return the number of the worker in the cell at row/col
      Parameters:
      row - of cell
      col - of cell
      Returns:
      int workerNum

    • setColor

      public void setColor​(int row, int col, java.lang.String color)
      it's a representation of Worker's setWorker method.
      Parameters:
      row - of the grid.
      col - of the grid.
      color - of the player/worker.

    • getColor

      public java.lang.String getColor​(int row, int col)
      return the color of the worker into the specified cell of the grid
      Parameters:
      row - of the grid.
      col - of the grid.
      Returns:
      the color of the worker

    • move

      public void move​(int oldRow, int oldCol, int newRow, int newCol)
      it's a representation of Worker's move method
      Parameters:
      oldRow - the row of previous worker's position.
      oldCol - the column of previous worker's position.
      newRow - the row of the actual worker's position.
      newCol - the column of the actual worker's position.

    • apolloDoubleMove

      public void apolloDoubleMove​(int oldRow1, int oldCol1, int oldRow2, int oldCol2)
      it's a representation of Apollo's move method
      Parameters:
      oldRow1 - the row of previous Apollo's position (which is other worker's actual position).
      oldCol1 - the column of previous Apollo's position (which is other worker's actual position).
      oldRow2 - the row of previous other worker's position (which is Apollo's actual position).
      oldCol2 - the column of previous other worker's position (which is Apollo's actual position).

    • minotaurDoubleMove

      public void minotaurDoubleMove​(int oldRow1, int oldCol1, int oldRow2, int oldCol2, int newRow2, int newCol2)
      it's a representation of Minotaur's move method
      Parameters:
      oldRow1 - the row of Minotaur's previous position.
      oldCol1 - the column of Minotaur's previous position.
      oldRow2 - the row of the other worker's previous position (which is Minotaur's actual position).
      oldCol2 - the column of the other worker's previous position (which is Minotaur's actual position).
      newRow2 - the row of the other worker's actual position.
      newCol2 - the column of the other worker's actual position.

    • setWorkerNumColors

      private void setWorkerNumColors​(int oldRow1, int oldCol1, int oldRow2, int oldCol2, int newRow2, int newCol2)
      Set workers' numbers and colors for designated cells
      Parameters:
      oldRow1 - of type int
      oldCol1 - of type int
      oldRow2 - of type int
      oldCol2 - of type int
      newRow2 - of type int
      newCol2 - of type int

    • build

      public void build​(int row, int col, boolean dome)
      it's a representation of worker's build method
      Parameters:
      row - the row of build position.
      col - the column of build position.
      dome - true if worker wants to build a dome instead of a block. (Only for Atlas workers)
